t: Psalm 7
Prayer and Praise for Deliverance from Enemies
A Meditation of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning the words of Cush, a Benjamite.
O*pn Lord*s my God, in You I put my trust; Save*ld me from all those who persecute me; And*ld deliver me,
Lest*ld they tear me like a lion, Rending*ld me*i in pieces, while there*i is*i none to deliver.
O*ln Lord*s my God, if I have done this: If*ld there is iniquity in my hands,
If*ld I have repaid evil to him who was at peace with me, Or*ld have plundered my enemy without cause,
Let*ld the enemy pursue me and overtake me;*i Yes,*ld let him trample my life to the earth, And*ld lay my honor in the dust. Selah*ipg
Arise,*pn O Lord,*s in Your anger; Lift*ld Yourself up because of the rage of my enemies; Rise*ld up for me to*i the judgment You have commanded!
So*ld the congregation of the peoples shall surround You; For*ld their sakes, therefore, return on high.
The*ld Lord*s shall judge the peoples; Judge*ld me, O Lord,*s according to my righteousness, And*ld according to my integrity within me.
Oh,*ln let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, But*ld establish the just; For*ld the righteous God tests the hearts and minds.
My*ld defense is*i of God, Who*ld saves the upright in heart.
God*ln is*i a just judge, And*ld God is angry with*i the*i wicked*i every day.
If*ld he does not turn back, He*ld will sharpen His sword; He*ld bends His bow and makes it ready.
He*ld also prepares for Himself instruments of death; He*ld makes His arrows into fiery shafts.
Behold,*ln the*i wicked*i brings forth iniquity; Yes,*ld he conceives trouble and brings forth falsehood.
He*ld made a pit and dug it out, And*ld has fallen into the ditch which*i he made.
His*ld trouble shall return upon his own head, And*ld his violent dealing shall come down on his own crown.
I*ln will praise the Lord*s according to His righteousness, And*ld will sing praise to the name of the Lord*s Most High.
